content: मिथ्या {%<ab>ind.</ab>%} [मिथ्-क्यप्] {@--1@} Falsely, deceitfully, wrongly, incorrectly; <ab>oft.</ab> with the force of an adjective; मणौ महानील इति प्रभावादल्पप्रमाणेऽपि यथा न मिथ्या <ls>R. 18. 42</ls>; यदुवाच न तन्मिथ्या <ls n="R.">17. 42</ls>; मिथ्यैव व्यसनं वदंति मृगयामीदृग्विनोदः कुतः <ls>Ś. 2. 5.</ls> {@--2@} Invertedly, contrarily. {@--3@} To no purpose, in vain, fruitlessly; मिथ्या कारयते चारैर्घोषणां राक्षसाधिपः <ls>Bk. 8. 44</ls>; <ls>Bg. 18. 59.</ls> (मिथ्या वद्-वच् to tell a falsehood, lie; मिथ्या कृ {1} to falsify. {2} to contradict. मिथ्या भू to turn out false, be false; मिथ्या ग्रह् to misunderstand, mistake). At the beginning of <ab>comp.</ab> मिथ्या may be translated by ‘false, untrue, unreal, sham, pretended, feigned’ &c.
